tool.name: VCFselectsamples:
tool.description: Select samples from a VCF dataset
tool.command: vcfkeepsamples "${input1}" ${ ' '.join( map( lambda x:'"%s"' % ( x ), str($vcf_samples ).split(",") ) ) } > "${out_file1}"

param.name: vcf_samples
param.label: Check to keep samples; Uncheck to remove

tool.help:
Allows to keep or remove samples from a VCF file.
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Example**:
Selecting *NA00001* and *NA00003* from the following VCF line::
#CHROM POS ID REF ALT QUAL FILTER INFO FORMAT NA00001 NA00002 NA00003 20 1110696 rs6040355 A G,T 67 PASS NS=2;DP=10;AF=0.333,0.667;AA=T;DB GT:GQ:DP:HQ 1|2:21:6:23,27 2|1:2:0:18,2 2/2:35:4:.,.
will, obviously, remove *NA00002*::
#CHROM POS ID REF ALT QUAL FILTER INFO FORMAT NA00001 NA00003 20 1110696 rs6040355 A G,T 67 PASS NS=2;DP=10;AF=0.333,0.667;AA=T;DB GT:GQ:DP:HQ 1|2:21:6:23,27 2/2:35:4:.,.
----
Vcfselectsamples is based on vcfkeepsamples/vcfremovesamples utilities from **VCFlib** toolkit developed by Erik Garrison (https://github.com/ekg/vcflib).
